    • Method Detail

      • createModule

        public Module createModule(java.lang.String instanceName,
                  DependencyResolver dependencyResolver,
                  DynamicMBeanWithInstance old,
                  org.osgi.framework.BundleContext bundleContext)
                    throws java.lang.Exception
        Description copied from interface: ModuleFactory
        Create a new Module instance. The returned object is expected to use the dependencyResolver provided when resolving ObjectNames to actual Module instances. A reference to an abstract view of the previous configuration is also provided in the form of a DynamicMBean. Implementations should use the MBeanInfo interface to understand the structure of the configuration information. Structural information impacts hot-swap operations in that in order to perform such a swap the newly loaded code needs to understand the previously-running instance configuration layout and how to map it onto itself.
        Specified by:
        createModule in interface ModuleFactory
        Overrides:
        createModule in class AbstractNetconfConnectorModuleFactory
        dependencyResolver - This resolver will return actual config mbean based on its ObjectName.
        old - existing module from platform MBeanServer that is being reconfigured. Implementations should inspect its attributes using DynamicMBean#getAttribute(String) and set those attributes on newly created module. If reconfiguration of live instances is supported, this live instance can be retreived using DynamicMBeanWithInstance.getInstance() . It is possible that casting this old instance throws ClassCastException when OSGi bundle is being updated. In this case, implementation should revert to creating new instance.
        bundleContext - Reference to OSGi bundleContext that can be used to acquire OSGi services, startup configuration and other OSGi related information.
        Returns:
        newly created module
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if it is not possible to recover configuration from old. This leaves server in a running state but no configuration transaction can be created.

      • createModule

                  DependencyResolver dependencyResolver,
                  org.osgi.framework.BundleContext bundleContext)
        Description copied from interface: ModuleFactory
        Create a new Module instance. The returned object is expected to use the dependencyResolver provided when resolving ObjectNames to actual Module instances.
